2.t: I swear by the illustrious Book.

3.t: that We have revealed the Quran on a blessed night to warn mankind.
3.tr: Innaaa anzalnaahu fee lailatim mubaarakah; innaa kunnaa munzireen

4.t: On this night, every absolute command coming from Us becomes distinguishable.

5.t: The command that We have been sending

6.t: as a mercy (for the human being) from your Lord. Your Lord is All-hearing and All-knowing.
6.tr: Rahmatam mir rabbik; innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem

7.t: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if only you would have strong faith.
7.tr: Rabbis samaawaati wal-ardi Wa-maa bainahumaa; in kuntum mooqineen

8.t: There is only One Lord. It is He who gives life and causes things to die. He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
8.tr: Laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa yuhyee Wa-yumeetu Rabbukum Wa-Rabbu aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen

9.t: In fact, the unbelievers have doubts because of excessive involvement in worldly affairs.

10.t: Wait for the day (which will come before the Day of Judgment) when the sky will give out dense smoke
10.tr: Fartaqib Yawma ta'tis samaaa'u bi-dukhaanin mubeen

11.t: which will smother the people. They will say, "This is a painful torment.

12.t: Lord, remove this torment from us for we are believers".

13.t: How could this punishment bring them to their senses when a Messenger evidently had come to them,
13.tr: Annaa lahumuz zikraa Wa-qad jaaa'ahum Rasoolum mubeen

14.t: and they turned away, saying, "He is a trained and insane person".

15.t: We shall remove the torment for a while but you will revert to your old ways.

16.t: However, We shall truly take Our revenge on the day when the great seizure takes place.
16.tr: Yawma nabtishul batsha-tal kubraa innaa muntaqimoon

17.t: We had certainly tested the people of the Pharaoh before them to whom a noble Messengers had come, saying,
17.tr: Wa-laqad fatannaa qablahum qawma Fir'awna Wa-jaaa'ahum Rasoolun kareem

18.t: "Send the servants of God with me. I am a trustworthy Messenger sent to you.
18.tr: An addooo ilaiya 'ibaadal laahi innee lakum Rasoolun ameen

19.t: Do not consider yourselves above God? I shall show you a manifest authority (in support of my truthfulness).
19.tr: Wa-al laa ta'loo 'alal laahi innee aateekum bisultaanim mubeen

20.t: I seek protection from my Lord and your Lord from your decision of stoning me.

21.t: If you do not want to believe, leave me alone".

22.t: Moses addressed his Lord, saying, "Lord, these people are sinners".
22.tr: Fada'aa rabbahooo anna haaa'ulaaa'i qawmum mujrimoon

23.t: We told him, "Leave the city with My servants during the night. You will be pursued.

24.t: Cross the sea by cutting a path through it. Pharaoh's army will be drowned.
24.tr: Watrukil bahra rahwan innahum jundum mughraqoon

25.t: How many were the gardens, springs,

27.t: and other bounties which they enjoyed yet left behind!

28.t: We gave these as an inheritance to other people.

29.t: The sky nor the earth cried for them, nor were they given respite.
29.tr: Famaa bakat 'alaihimus samaaa'u wal-ardu Wa-maa kaanoo munzareen

30.t: We rescued the Israelites from the humiliating torment
30.tr: Wa-laqad najjainaa Baneee Israaa'eela minal 'azaabil muheen

31.t: and from the Pharaoh. He was the chief of the transgressors.
31.tr: Min Fir'awn; innahoo kaana 'aaliyam minal musrifeen

32.t: We gave preference to the Israelites over the other people with Our knowledge

33.t: and sent them revelations of which some were a clear trial for them.
33.tr: Wa-aatainaahum minal aayaati maa feehi balaaa'um mubeen

35.t: "After we die, we shall never be raised to life again.
35.tr: In hiya illaa mawtatunal oolaa Wa-maa nahnu bimun-shareen

36.t: Bring back to life our fathers if what you say is true".

37.t: Are they better than the tribe of Tubba (name of a Yemenite tribal chief) and those who lived before them? We destroyed them. They were criminals.
37.tr: Ahum khayrun am qawmu Tubba'inw wallazeena min qablihim; ahlaknaahum innahum kaanoo mujrimeen

38.t: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them for Our own amusement.
38.tr: Wa-maa khalaqnas samaawaati wal-arda Wa-maa baina-humaa laa'ibeen

39.t: We have created them for a genuine purpose, but most people do not know.
39.tr: Maa khalaqnaahumaaa illaa bilhaqqi Wa-laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon

40.t: The appointed time for all of them will be the Day of Judgment

41.t: (when wrong will be distinguished from right). On this day friends will be of no benefit to one another, nor will they receive any help
41.tr: Yawma laa yughnee mawlan 'am mawlan shai'anw Wa-laa hum yunsaroon

42.t: except for those to whom God grants mercy. He is Majestic and All-merciful.
42.tr: Illaa mar rahimal laah' innahoo huwal 'azeezur raheem

45.t: It will be like molted brass which will boil in the bellies

47.t: (It will be said of such sinners), "Seize them and drag them into the middle of hell.

48.t: Then pour unto their heads the boiling water to torment them".
48.tr: Summa subboo fawqa ra'sihee min 'azaabil hameem

49.t: They will be told, "Suffer the torment. You had thought yourselves to be majestic and honorable.

50.t: This is the torment that you persistently doubted".
50.tr: Inna haazaa maa kuntum bihee tamtaroon

51.t: The pious ones will be in a secure place

53.t: clothed in fine silk and rich brocade, sitting face to face with one another.

54.t: We shall unite them to maidens with big black and white lovely eyes.

55.t: They will be offered all kinds of fruits, in peace and security.

56.t: They will not experience any death other than that which they have already been through.
56.tr: Laa yazooqoona feehal mawtaa illal mawtatal oolaa Wa-waqaahum 'azaabal jaheem

57.t: God will protect them from the torment of hell as a favor from your Lord. (Muhammad), this is certainly the greatest triumph.
57.tr: Fadlam mir rabbik; zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem

58.t: We have made the Quran easy for you to recite so that perhaps they may take heed.

59.t: Wait (for God's decree) and they too will be waiting.
